pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.changeFileExtension(fileName, newExtension)[source]¶

Changes file extension with new one.

Parameters:
  • fileName (str) – master file name
  • newExtension (str) – new file name extension
Returns:

new file name with extension changed.
Return type:

str

 
>>> print changeFileExtension("c:/temp/ahoj.txt", ".sql")
c:/temp/ahoj.sql

>>> print changeFileExtension("c:/temp/ahoj.txt", "sql")
c:/temp/ahoj.sql

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.createContainer(values)[source]¶

Create container for szmbolic values, equivalent of Pascal record or C struct commands.

Parameters:values (list) – values to be added as container properties
Returns:class instance with given properties
Return type:Container 
>>> a = createContainer({ "floatNumber": 3, "stringValue": "Test"})
>>> print a.__class__
base.Container
>>> print a.floatNumber, a.stringValue
3 Test
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.dump(shape)[source]¶

An equivalent of PostGIS st_dump command for shapely geometry. Returns first geom of shape or shape if not compoment element.

Parameters:shape (shapely.geometry.base.BaseGeometry) – Shapely geometry to be dumped.
Returns:First geom of shape or shape if not compoment element. 
>>> from shapely.geometry import Point, MultiPoint
>>> multiPoint = MultiPoint([Point(4, 1)])
>>> dump(multiPoint).wkt
'POINT (4 1)'
>>> dump(Point(5, 7)).wkt
'POINT (5 7)'

Returns:

extended list
Return type:

list

 
>>> extendListNoDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 4], [4, 5, 6])
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.extractFileName(fullFileName)[source]¶

Aliaz to pathLeaf. Extracts file name or directory name from given path.

Parameters:fullFileName (str) – Full or relative path
Returns:File name from given path.
Return type:str 
>>> extractFileName("c:/temp/test.html")
'test.html'

>>> extractFileName("c:/temp/")
'temp'

>>> content = fileRead(__name__ + ".py")
>>> print content.startswith("# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-")
True

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.formatValueIfNotEmpty(template, value)[source]¶

Formats value if template is given, if not, the just convert it into string. Returns empty string if value is None.

Parameters:
  • template (str) – string formating template
  • value (str) – value to be formated
Returns:

formatted value
Return type:

str

 
>>> formatValueIfNotEmpty("%3.1f", 8.54684)
'8.5'

>>> formatValueIfNotEmpty("%f3.1", None)
''

  • msg (str) – Message returned if condition is False.

str

'Condition is set to False.'

>>> getTableHTML([["Name", "Radek"], ["Street", "Chvalinska"]])

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.pairItems(iterator)[source]¶

Returns new iterator with subsequent tupple pairs of source iterator. I could be used for example for converting list of vertexes in a linestring to list of edges.

Parameters:iterator – Iterator for join pairs
Returns:Pairs iterator 
>>> pairs = pairItems([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
>>> for item in pairs:print item
(1, 2)
(2, 3)
(3, 4)
(4, 5)

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.replaceStringBlocks(str, startId, endId, newContent)[source]¶

Replaces all string sections in blocks given by startId and endId tags by newContent.

Parameters:
  • str (str) – Text content to be updated.
  • startId (str) – Start identifier of the block to be replaced.
  • endId (str) – End identifier of the block to be replaced.
  • newContent (str) – New text content.
Returns:

Updated str block.
Return type:

str

 
>>> replaceStringBlocks("Text pred.<ReplaceStart>StaryText<ReplaceEnd>Text za.", "<ReplaceStart>", "<ReplaceEnd>", "Next content.")
'Text pred.Next content.Text za.'
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.safeMkDir(path)[source]¶

Creates directory under path if not exists. Unlike os.makedirs, first check it and don’t raise error if yes.

Parameters:path (str) – Path of the directory to be created 
>>> path = "c:/temp/testdir_1234"
>>> safeMkDir(path)
>>> import os
>>> print os.path.exists(path)
True
>>> os.rmdir(path)

  • itemsToBeRemoved (list) – items to be removed
Returns:

list without items
Return type:

list

 
>>> safeRemoveItemsFromList([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 5])

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.saveDictToJSON(obj, fileName)[source]¶
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.saveJSONtoJavaScript(obj, identifier, javaScriptFileName)[source]¶

Saves obj to the JavaScript file as a identifier variable.

Parameters:
  • obj (dict) – object to be saved
  • identifier (str) – JavaScript reference variable name
  • javaScriptFileName (str) – JavaScript file name
 
>>> obj = { "value" : 3 }
>>> saveJSONtoJavaScript(obj, "testValue", "c:/temp/test.js")
>>> print open("c:/temp/test.js", "r").read()
testValue = {
    "value": 3
}
>>> os.remove("c:/temp/test.js")
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.saveStrToFile(str, fileName, encoding='utf-8')[source]¶

Saves given string str into file fileName using encoding parameter.

Parameters:
  • str (str) – String to be saved.
  • fileName (str) – Name of the created file.
  • encoding (str) – Character encoding, utf-8 as defatult.
 
>>> saveStrToFile("Ahoj", "c:/temp/testSaveToStr.txt")
>>> import os
>>> os.path.exists("c:/temp/testSaveToStr.txt")
True
>>> # Cleaning after test
>>> os.remove("c:/temp/testSaveToStr.txt")

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.setParameters(template, parameters)[source]¶

Replace values in a template string by given real values dictionary. Used mainly for SQL queries, enabling leave them working for copy&paste debugging.

Parameters:
  • template (str) – template string with identifiers to be replaced
  • parameters (dict) – dictionary where keys are identifiers in a template which have to be replaced by values
Return str:

template string with replaced values
Return type:

str

 
>>> template = "select ogc_fid from public.z_terrenrelief_l"
>>> str = setParameters(template, { "ogc_fid": "zrdoj_id", "public" : "temp"})
>>> print str
select zrdoj_id from temp.z_terrenrelief_l

Parameters:encoding – Selected encoding, if utf-8 is not appropriate. 
>>> setupEncoding("windows_1252")

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.base.variantCombinations(items)[source]¶

Calculates variant combinations for given list of options. Each item in the items list represents unique value with it’s variants.

Parameters:items (list) – list of values to be combined 
>>> c = variantCombinations([["1.1", "1.2"], ["2.1", "2.2"], ["3.1", "3.2"]])
>>> len(c)
8
>>> for combination in c:print combination
['1.1', '2.1', '3.1']
['1.1', '2.1', '3.2']
['1.1', '2.2', '3.1']
['1.1', '2.2', '3.2']
['1.2', '2.1', '3.1']
['1.2', '2.1', '3.2']
['1.2', '2.2', '3.1']
['1.2', '2.2', '3.2']

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.basepath module¶

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.basepath.normalizePath(relativePath)[source]¶

Path normalizer for template and configuration files. It will create full path for the file, relativePath is addressed to the directory one level higher than this module.

Parameters:relativePath – RelativePath, addressed to the directory one level higher than this module.
Returns:Absolute path of the relativePath parameter.

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.config.save(saveAll=False)[source]¶
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.config.setValue(key, value, callOnChange=True)[source]¶

Set value of configuration variable. If it doesn’t exist yet, creates one.

:param String key:Symbolic name of the variable. Use dot convention to make eventual hierarchy. :param Any value:Stored value. :param callOnChange: if true, on change value listener events are fired.

>>> setValue("myDatabase.key", 36)
>>> thisModule.myDatabase.key
36

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.htmlhelpers.replaceHTMLBlock(html, commentIdentifier, newContent)[source]¶

Replaces html content in block of <!– commentIdentifier –>Old content<!– end of commentIdentifier –> by new value.

Parameters:
  • html – source html containing section(s) to be replaced
  • commentIdentifier – identifier of section to be replaced
  • newContent – new content of identified section
Returns:

resulting html

 
>>> html = "<html><body><h1>Title</h1><p><!-- content -->Here should be page content<!-- end of content --></p></body></html>"
>>> html = replaceHTMLBlock(html, "content", "My content of page.")
>>> print html
<html><body><h1>Title</h1><p>My content of page.</p></body></html>
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.htmlhelpers.replaceHTMLTags(html, tags)[source]¶

<#LOGLINES#/> … just replace values <#LOGLINES#> … replace in block /* DATA */ … replace data in block //DATA … replace data in block

Parameters:
  • html –
  • tags –
Returns:

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.htmltools.getHtmlDiv(templateName, identifier)[source]¶

Extracts content of the html DIV element with given id. There must not be another div inside.

Parameters:
  • templateName (String) – Name of the template in the templates list.
  • identifier (String) – Id of the selected DIV element.
Return String:

Content of DIV element with given id.

 
>>> getHtmlDiv("sample", "mojeTestId")
'<p id="caption">Moje Caption</p><p id="shortDescription">Moje shortDescription</p><p id="description">Moje dDescription</p>'

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.htmltools.getTemplate(name)[source]¶

Return String:Template HTML content. 
>>> print getTemplate("sample")
ahoj<div id="mojeTestId"><p class="caption">Moje Caption</p><p class="shortDescription">Moje shortDescription</p><p class="description">Moje dDescription</p></div>

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.log module¶

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath module¶

class pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.Point(x=0, y=0, point=None)[source]¶
asShape¶
coords¶
distance(point)[source]¶

Calculates planar distance to point.

Parameters:point (Point) – Object to calculate distance to.
Return float:Planar distance between self and point. 
>>> a = Point(1, 1)
>>> b = Point(6, 6)
>>> a.distance(b)
7.0710678118654755
equals(point)[source]¶
move(dx, dy)[source]¶

Moves point by given distances in each coordinate.

Parameters:
  • dx (float) – Move distance in X axis.
  • dy (float) – Move distance in Y axis.
 
>>> a = Point(3, 5)
>>> a.move(1, 2)
>>> print a
Point(4.000000, 7.000000)
class pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.Vector(startPoint, endPoint=None, length=None, direction=None)[source]¶
Interpolate_Point(t, normalized=True)[source]¶

Alias to the function calcPointOn.

asShape¶
calcPointOn(t, normalized=True)[source]¶

Returns a point interpolated along a line.

Parameters:
  • t (float) – Distance or length fraction from the start point.
  • normalized (boolean) – If normalised set to True, then second argument t is a float between 0 and 1 representing fraction of total length of linestring the point has to be located.

If not, then t means length from the start point to the resulting point. :return Point: Interpolated point.

>>> edge = Vector(Point(10, 10), Point(50, 50))
>>> edge.calcPointOn(0.5, True)
>>> edge.calcPointOn(0.5, True)
Point(30.000000, 30.000000)
coords¶
extent(targetLength)[source]¶

Adjust the vector so it’s resulting length is as of targetLength parameter.

Parameters:targetLength (float) – 
>>> edge = Vector(Point(10, 10), Point(50, 50))
>>> edge.extent(12)
>>> print edge, edge.length()
Vector(Point(10.000000, 10.000000), Point(18.485281, 18.485281)) 12.0
getDirection()[source]¶

Returns direction from the start point to the end point.

Return float:Direction from the start point to the end point. 
>>> edge = Vector(Point(0, 0), Point(-1, 0))
>>> edge.getDirection()
3.141592653589793
length()[source]¶

Calculates vector lenght.

Return float:Length of the vector. 
>>> edge = Vector(Point(3, 3), Point(5, 5))
>>> edge.length()
2.8284271247461903
normalize()[source]¶

Builds unit vector of the same direction starting from the origin.

>>> edge = Vector(Point(10, 10), Point(50, 50))
>>> edge.normalize()
>>> print edge
Vector(Point(0.000000, 0.000000), Point(0.707107, 0.707107))
>>> print edge.length()
1.0
normalized¶
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.calcArea(vertexes)[source]¶
Parameters:vertexes –
Return Float:Area of the polygon, Positive value means clockwise direction, negative counter-clockwise. 
>>> calcArea([Point(0, 0), Point(0, 1), Point(1, 1), Point(1, 0)])
-1.0

>>> calcArea([Point(0, 0), Point(1, 0), Point(1, 1), Point(0, 1)])
1.0

pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.calcShapeBearingAt(shape, point)[source]¶

Calculates bearing of the shape element at the spot nearest to the point.

Parameters:
  • shape – Element to calculate bearing at.
  • point – Point to calculate element spot for bearing.
Returns:

Bearing at the projected sopt from point in radians.
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.constructPoint(point, bearing, lenght, vertical)[source]¶

Constructs point by given parameters.

Parameters:
  • point – Point for constructing line from.
  • bearing – Bearing for calculation.
  • lenght – Length of constructing vector.
  • vertical – if True, then calculate vertial.
Returns:

Point as shapely array [x, y]

Centers shape element around stream element.

Parameters:

  • stream – Shapely element as center line.
Returns:

Moved shape element.
pygeotoolbox.sharedtools.planarmath.normalizeAngle(value, limit=6.283185307179586)[source]¶

Returns normalized angle in interval (0, 2*Pi) or given value.

Parameters:
  • value (float) – Value to be normalized.
  • limit – Normalization high limit.
Returns:

Value in interval (0, limit)

 
>>> normalizeAngle(78.2)
2.801776313844968
